sub_title: Mixed Use Areas & Partnerships | Manager | Supervisory Board Member | Executive MBA Candidate specializing in Public & Private
summary:
I've over 15 years of working experience within real estate (mixed use / commercial / retail/hospitality) and large scale urban development. Besides I initiated, led and contributed to several strategic corporate transitions. 

My specialties: a clear vision on results to be achieved, naturally aligning stakeholders interests, creating high quality concepts & plans, creating & contracting partnerships, leading project teams and stakeholders with creativity and driven by issues that matter to society. 

Specific expertises: (commercial) real estate & retail, urban development & sustainability, mobility & transfer, user experience.

After finishing my masters at TU/e (summa cum laude) incl. several interns,  I started my career at New Amsterdam Development Consultants. NADC's experienced team of urban developers learned me to align the complex conditions of large scale area development projects by housing corporations (Rotterdam/Amsterdam).

After 2 years I had the opportunity to join TCN, developer/owner of commercial real estate, famous for its innovative concepts and branding strategies. I've developed and implemented real estate concepts and long term strategies, focusing on large scale business parks like Media Park and Energy Business Park Arnhem. Unfortunately TCN had to quit all of its activities 2 years later.

Then - for 5 years - I have developed stations and surrounding areas by integrating mobility, retail, hotel and public space. I enjoyed inspiring others by sharing ways to integrate mobility, stations and the city. I've worked on 3 corporate strategies enabling me to think strategically about the future of companies.

As of 2017, for 2 years, I have been employed at EDGE Technologies / OVG Real Estate and thereby responsible for the acquisition of healthier working projects in Paris.

Current, I work at AM - among Dutch largest area developers - and responsible for the acquisition and development of Mixed Use projects.

courses.name: LEAN Management Blue Belt, NS Group

profile_positions.description: AM | Inspiring Space: Inspirerende en duurzame leefomgevingen bedenken en ontwikkelen, dat is de passie van AM. Als betrokken gebiedsontwikkelaar plaatsen wij maatschappelijke uitdagingen in het hart van ons ontwikkelingsproces. Wij richten ons daarbij op de thema’s ‘Gedurfde duurzaamheid’, ‘Inclusieve stad’, ‘Healthy urban living and working’, ‘Stad- en gebiedmaker’ en ‘Gelukkig leven’.
profile_positions.title: Developing Mixed Use Areas and Partnerships

profile_positions.description:
DePlaatsmaker maakt plaats voor kunst en creativiteit.
DePlaatsmaker organiseert passende ruimten voor kunstenaars en creatieven. Samen met partners ontwikkelen we ruimte voor creatief Utrecht. Door nieuwe mogelijkheden te verkennen en te ontwikkelen. Om zo de groeiende vraag naar deze ruimten te vervullen. Ruimte voor kunst voegt waarde toe aan de leefbaarheid, diversiteit en aantrekkingskracht van een buurt en de stad.
profile_positions.title: Voorzitter Raad van Toezicht bij Deplaatsmaker

profile_positions.description:
EDGE Technologies specialises in a new generation of healthy, technologically innovative and energy-positive office buildings. 

At EDGE Technologies I have been responsible for the execution of our international ambitions to develop healthier working environments in Paris. I have established our professional network, represented EDGE Technologies at several public stages and investigated the real estate market in order to find new opportunities for 'EDGE Paris'.

Besides I’ve led the implementation of the corporate transition from OVG Real Estate (process centred company) to EDGE Technologies (product centred company).
profile_positions.title: Senior Commercial Manager (Paris)

company.name: SWK 030 - Creative Studio's and Incubators Utrecht

profile_positions.company: SWK 030 - Creative Studio's and Incubators Utrecht
profile_positions.title: Board Member

profile_positions.description:
FRESH is the network linking ambitious students and the professional real estate sector. Today, there are more than 1000 students FRESH-members, both Dutch and international students.

The supervisory board points out the strategy of FRESH on the mid- and longterm, advises the students board as a group and coaches the students board using a individual buddy system.

I'm highly motivated to coach junior professionals during their first stages of professional life. My role as chairman of the Supervisory Board has allowed me to develop and practice these skills professionally.

Our partners: CBRE Global Investors, OVG Real Estate, JLL

Our sponsors: BBN Adviseurs, A.S.R., DTZ Zadelhoff, Deloitte, SWECO, Bouwfonds investment management, Savills, Wereldhave, Unibail Rodamco, BPD, Loyens & Loeff, Eurocommercial
profile_positions.title: Chairman of Supervisory Board / Raad van Commissarissen

company.name: NS Stations Real Estate & Development (Dutch Railways)

profile_positions.description:
General description: responsible for the redevelopment (initiative, master plan, design, finance and PPS-contracting) of railway stations and surrounding urban areas. Besides, I have been managing several teams proposing future (corporate) strategies for NS Stations and its > 400 stations.

My station (area) projects: Harderwijk, Spoorzone Groningen, Spoorzone Ede, Amsterdam Lelylaan, Amsterdam Muiderpoort.

Management teams: part of the management teams of Spoorzone Groningen, Spoorzone Ede, Amsterdam Lelylaan.

My specialties within the development process: having a clear vision on results to be achieved, naturally aligning interests of multiple stakeholders, creating high quality concepts/designs, contracting partnerships, structuring project teams with a high level of energy.

Corporate strategy I 'Station area as catalyst': initiation, development and successful implementation of corporate strategy for the redevelopment of urban areas surrounding Dutch railway stations and the positioning of NS Stations within this.

Corporate strategy II 'Stations 2.0': strategy member for development of new corporate strategy of NS Stations. Achieved goal was to restructure the organisation to support an increasing focus on hospitality & service at Dutch railway stations.

Corporate strategy 'Future Station Programs 2030':  programme manager and creative leadership of new station development strategy of NS Stations and ProRail. Large team with members of NS Stations as well as ProRail. Goal was to define future station programs for 2030 based on trends, growth expectations, stakeholder interests and corporate responsibilities. 

International acquisition: start up of retail on stations in the United Kingdom. Within one year after start, NS Stations had opened several retail shops on stations in England and clear perspective on further roll out on stations incl. Scotland.
profile_positions.title: Asset Developer / Stationsontwikkelaar / Gebiedsontwikkelaar

profile_positions.description:
Concept and business development Media Park Hilversum: development of asset business plan with new solutions for existing buildings and existing and new tenants (VARA, RTL, etc.)

Concept and business development Energy Business Park Arnhem: development of asset business plan with new solutions for existing buildings and existing and new tenants (KEMA, TenneT, etc.)

Team management: implementation of new asset business plans by drawing out action plans and setting goals for the operating team. 

Market and portfolio analysis commercial real estate: large office portfolio's (>50 buildings), market analysis for specific industries such as media, energy, retail.

Several other concepts and branding strategies for clients, for example: area concept Oosterdokseiland (Stadgenoot), new head office Talpa (different concepts for several locations), new head office VARA/BNN (different concepts for several locations), area concept and branding strategy Merwestein (municipality of Nieuwegein)
profile_positions.title: Concept Developer

profile_positions.description:
General description: Working as a consultant on the (re)development of inner city areas for housing corporations in Amsterdam and Rotterdam

Concept development: Krugerplein Amsterdam, Kromhouthal  (river front) Amsterdam, Lasloods & Nieuw Dakota NDSM (river front) Amsterdam

Area development: transformation Merwehaven Rotterdam (Haversteder, Uit Je Eigen Stad); project secretary at City.Corp, the joined structure founded by Com.wonen/PHS/Stadswonen/Woonstad/SOR, responsible for joined area development projects including projects like Coolhaven/Baankwartier, Hofbogen, Woudestein en Merwehaven.

Contracting & construction: Nieuw Dakota art galleries at NDSM wharf (former ship yard location at the north banks of river IJ, Amsterdam). 

Research & policy development: new BREEAM-NL label for sustainable urban areas (DGBC), role of public/private partnerships for Urban Park Investments and Management, privatization of Dutch housing corporations
profile_positions.title: Urban Development Consultant / Gebiedsontwikkelaar

profile_positions.description:
Working as a consultant for urban developments which integrate leisure & arts industries.
Writing a master thesis about real estate developments for the creative industries.
profile_positions.title: Consultancy intern
